intro: Sinapis schkuhriana, commonly known as the Schkuhriana mustard, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard species. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring lobed leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. Its seeds are small and contain compounds that have been studied for their potential medicinal properties. The plant is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
